abstract: Supreme Court issues order allowing certain nonprofit religious groups to avoid compliance with federal requirements under health care reform law concerning insurance coverage of contraceptives for women until justices decide whether to hear appeal.
lead_paragraph: An order bars the Obama administration from enforcing the rules against some religious groups until the Supreme Court decides whether to hear an appeal.

headline.main: Court Lets Some Charities Avoid Rules on Birth Control Coverage
headline.print_headline: Court Lets Some Charities Avoid Rules on Birth Control Coverage

snippet: An order bars the Obama administration from enforcing the rules against some religious groups until the Supreme Court decides whether to hear an appeal.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
